vignette.name: Impulse Responses
vignette.p: The HISSTools Impulse Response Toolbox includes a number of impulse response (IR) files, primarily for loading into the hirt.convolutionreverb~ and the hirt.convolver~ abstractions. These can both accept multiple types of IRs, such as mono-mono, mono-stereo, stereo-stereo, quad-stereo ('true stereo'). IRs are listed in menus in the interfaces of both abstractions, but can also be listed in patches using the collection attribute to umenu (an example of this is included in the irstats~ helpfile). Files are also listed in the HIRT section of the Max Browser.
The HIRT also provides means for creating your own impulse responses. Most notably the hirt.irmaker~ abstraction, or individual objects such as irmeasure~, irreference~ and iruser~.

Whilst the currently available collection of IR files may be expanded with new IRs in future updates to the package, there are many resources available for further information and for permissively licensed impulse response file downloads. Below we list some of our favourites.
